data.title: This church is old and wonderful to see; even outside.
data.text: My oldest memory of this church is the beauty behind the choir area. A great wedding and any special event can hold many people

data.title: Beautiful Church
data.text: This is the most beautiful church in my opinion but I am biased since I go to church here. The stained glass windows are just amazing. My husband and I got married here. The church is undergoing a 2 year structural renovation starting August 2016 but the chapel is still open and it is very charming

data.title: Beautiful old church, but note: Sanctuary closing for repairs
data.text: We like visiting churches anywhere we go, and enjoyed the Sunday service here.  The windows and architecture make it a gem, and we were made to feel quite welcome by the clergy.  But visitors should note that extensive building repairs are due soon, which will close the sanctuary for about 2 years.  In the meantime, admire it from the outside!

data.title: Mother Church of the Diocese, an island of calm
data.text: Walk in quietly, lift your eyes, and drop to your knees, as worshippers have done for more than a hundred years.  But please don't talk, unless you wish to speak to God.

data.title: Went for the organ recital
data.text: A beautiful old church with lovely stained glass,  It was so peaceful inside, tranquil, and the organ recital was glorious.

data.title: worship
data.text: Great church. Beautiful stain glass windows. Church has lost the real reason why thy are there. Much friction over gays and the church stance on this subject. Great historic grave yard with lots of history.

data.title: Beautiful Old Church
data.text: Really neat old (185 old) church with a graveyard on the property.  They offer traditional and contemporary services.  Visitors are welcome and do not stand out for recruitment.

data.title: Welcoming and special
data.text: In visiting Greenville, I attended Christ Church and was met with wonderful southern friendliness. The service was just what I needed. I will return on my next visit. Thanks...

data.title: Organ performance
data.text:
It was a noon time organ performance from the Lee Rd. Meth. organist.  He started at Lee Rd. when he was 13 and is still there.  He is a Junior at Furman University.  His choice of music was very good.  The church in itself is a fabulous place to visit.  The stained glass windows are something that you just can't tell about, it is something that
you have to see on your own.

data.title: Beautiful sanctuary in historic church where traditions should stay true to the faith.
data.text: Historic church with prominent graveyard of noteworthy South  Carolinians. The traditional services are reverent and meaningful.  Avoid the modernistic 'entertainment' services. The stained glass windows and fabulous organ add depth to the commune with God in His place.  It is nice to have a quiet place to reflect and worship with a lovely chapel on the same grounds.

data.title: Beautiful. Reverent with wonderful cemetery.
data.text: We just like old churches and this is one of the most beautiful around Greenville. Building is beautiful. Park in back and get full effect of church. Front is busy but back view is peaceful. Many beautiful carved monuments to peruse. Can't say anything about inside. We ran out of time.

data.title: Beautiful High Church
data.text: Came for the Tiffany window, stayed for the service. Beautiful 1920's style architecture.  The school attached to the church is #1.

data.title: wonderful church home, very inviting
data.text: This truly is a joyful community. Christ Church dispells all rumours of stuffiness the second you walk through the doors. All the tradition of an established Episcopal church with all the love and warmth that only comes from a commited family.

data.title: Must go
data.text: Listen to the organ it is amazing        ..............     and the windows are too. It's a must see      !!!!!! place.

data.title: Beautiful, iconic, inspiring
data.text: This beautiful historic landmark is simply a must-see.  Its rare stained glass window is the loveliest thing I have ever seen, and I lived in New Orleans.

data.title: Готическая церковь в Гринвилле
data.text: Церковь из коричневого камня, построена в форме креста, в 19 веке. Самая старая в городке. На церковном кладбище похоронены известные горожане
